articles.description: BBC Sport takes a look at the Premier League's most in-form players after Man City boss Pep Guardiola talked up Phil Foden.
articles.title: Is Foden 'the best in the Premier League right now'?

articles.description: The president of motorsport's governing body is under investigation for an alleged attempt to interfere over a Formula 1 race result.
articles.title: Mohammed Ben Sulayem: FIA president under investigation for alleged attempt to interfere over F1 race

articles.description: Could Anthony Joshua v Francis Ngannou winner fight for the undisputed title next, despite a two-fight deal in place between champions Tyson Fury and Oleksandr Usyk?
articles.title: Anthony Joshua v Francis Ngannou: Could winner fight for undisputed title next?

articles.description: England spinner Tom Hartley hopes Nathan Lyon's arrival at Lancashire can be a "game-changer" for his bowling.
articles.title: I hope Lyon is a game-changer for me - Hartley

articles.description: The Boston Celtics thrash the Golden State Warriors 140-88 as they extend their winning streak to 11 games.
articles.title: NBA: Boston Celtics thrash Golden State Warriors for 11th straight win

articles.description: Britain's Katie Boulter recovers from a set down to beat Marta Kostyuk in the San Diego Open final.
articles.title: Katie Boulter beats Marta Kostyuk to win San Diego Open title

articles.description: Antoine Dupont helps France's men to claim their first sevens title in 19 years as they beat Great Britain 21-0 in the final in Los Angeles.
articles.title: Dupont inspires France to beat GB in sevens final

articles.description: Three thrilling three days of action at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in Glasgow have set Team GB up perfectly for the Olympics.
articles.title: World Athletics Indoor Championships 2024: Olympics in sights for Josh Kerr & Molly Caudery

articles.description: Andrey Rublev wins his appeal against losing his ranking points and prize money after being disqualified from the Dubai Tennis Championships.
articles.title: Andrey Rublev ranking points and prize money reinstated after appeal

articles.description: Edinburgh lock Marshall Sykes is recalled to the Scotland squad for the first time in two years for the Six Nations game in Italy.
articles.title: Scotland recall lock Sykes after two-year absence
